perturbation.original_text: This Agreement shall be governed by, and construed and enforced in accordance with, the laws of the State of California and the laws of Hong Kong.  In the event of a dispute, the parties shall seek mediation at a third country mutually agreed upon.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement shall be governed by, and construed and enforced in accordance with, the laws of the State of California.  In the event of a dispute, the parties may consider mediation, but such mediation shall not be a mandatory step prior to any legal proceedings.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause mandates mediation in a third country mutually agreed upon before any dispute resolution. The modified clause makes mediation optional and removes the third-country requirement, potentially conflicting with standard dispute resolution procedures expected under California law, which generally favors good faith attempts at resolution prior to litigation. This contradiction undermines the enforceability of the dispute resolution process.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Code of Civil Procedure ยง 1775.2(a)

perturbation.original_text: All covenants, promises and agreements by or on behalf of the parties contained in this Agreement shall be binding upon and shall inure to the benefit of the successors and assigns of the  parties; but nothing in this Agreement, expressed or implied is intended to confer on any party the right to assign its rights or  obligations hereunder.  Nothing in this Agreement, whether  expressed or implied, is intended to confer any rights or remedies  under or by reason of this Agreement on any persons other than the parties to it and their respective successors and assigns, nor is anything in this Agreement intended to relieve or discharge the obligation or liability of any third persons to any party to this Agreement, nor shall any provision give any third person any right of subrogation or action over or against any party to this  Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: All covenants, promises and agreements by or on behalf of the parties contained in this Agreement shall be binding upon and shall inure to the benefit of the successors and assigns of the  parties; and this Agreement, expressed or implied is intended to confer on any party the right to assign its rights or  obligations hereunder.  Nothing in this Agreement, whether  expressed or implied, is intended to confer any rights or remedies  under or by reason of this Agreement on any persons other than the parties to it and their respective successors and assigns, nor is anything in this Agreement intended to relieve or discharge the obligation or liability of any third persons to any party to this Agreement, nor shall any provision give any third person any right of subrogation or action over or against any party to this  Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause explicitly prohibits the assignment of rights or obligations. The modified clause contradicts this by stating that the agreement 'is intended to confer on any party the right to assign its rights or obligations hereunder'. This creates a direct contradiction within the same clause, making it unclear whether assignment is permitted or prohibited, thus weakening the enforceability of the clause related to rights and obligations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California contract law regarding assignment of contracts.
